title: unusual M's & W's
content:
Is there many fonts with m/w's made out of two pieces like in attachment please and thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2013-01-31 at 13.58.13.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-01-31%20at%2013.58.13.png) | 7.6 KB |
author: typeinfo

comments.content:
Actually, it'(wa)s some kind of trend: [Diamonds](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/diamonds/), [Evolette A](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/26plus-zeichen.de/en/fonts/tj-evolette-a/), [Lightyears](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/matchandkerosene/lightyears), many ones at [TenDollarFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/) (TWOFACED, Echelon, Rathe, Parqa, Fonecian, Finding 57, Harf 77, Labieno, Positano, Marina, Alumia...)  
More inspiration: [I Am So Tired With Your Experimental Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/experimentalsans.tumblr.com/)

BTW, who runs TenDollarFonts? Their domain registration is covered up.

hhp
Best I can come up with (using NeoTrace) is "Special Domain Services" in Scottsdale, AZ. Registered via GoDaddy.

Or, as noted on their website:  
 [http://www.tendollarfonts.com/friends](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304144751/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/friends "http://www.tendollarfonts.com/friends")

"Daniel McQueen - Owner of Ten Dollar Fonts"
